current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize the exploration, leasing, development, production, and economically feasible and
			 prudent transportation of oil and gas in and from the Coastal Plain in
			 Alaska.

header.#text:
Leasing program
			 for land within the Coastal Plain

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
authorizes the exploration, leasing, development, production, and
			 economically
			 feasible and prudent transportation of oil and gas in and from the Coastal
			 Plain.
shall take such actions as are necessary—

text.#text: The

to establish and
			 implement, in accordance with this Act, a competitive oil and gas leasing
			 program that will result in an environmentally sound program for the
			 exploration, development, and production of the oil and gas resources of
			 the
			 Coastal Plain; and

to administer
			 this Act through regulations, lease terms, conditions, restrictions,
			 prohibitions, stipulations, and other provisions that—

ensure the oil
			 and gas exploration, development, and production activities on the Coastal
			 Plain will result in no significant adverse effect on fish and wildlife,
			 fish and wildlife
			 habitat, subsistence resources, and the environment; and

require the
			 application of the best commercially available technology for oil and gas
			 exploration, development, and production to all exploration, development,
			 and
			 production operations under this Act in a manner that ensures the receipt
			 of
			 fair market value by the public for the mineral resources to be leased.

header.#text:
No significant
			 adverse effect standard To govern authorized coastal plain
			 activities

text.#text:
ensure, to the
			 maximum extent practicable, that oil and gas exploration, development, and
			 production activities on the Coastal Plain will result in no significant
			 adverse effect on fish and wildlife, fish and wildlife habitat,
			 subsistence resources, and the
			 environment;

require the
			 application of the best commercially available technology for oil and gas
			 exploration, development, and production on all new exploration,
			 development,
			 and production operations; and

ensure that the
			 maximum surface acreage covered in connection with the leasing program by
			 production and support facilities, including airstrips and any areas
			 covered by
			 gravel berms or piers for support of pipelines, does not exceed 2,000
			 acres on
			 the Coastal Plain.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require, with
			 respect to any proposed drilling and related activities on the Coastal
			 Plain,
			 that—

text.#text: The

a site-specific
			 environmental analysis be made of the probable effects, if any, that the
			 drilling or related activities will have on fish and wildlife, fish and
			 wildlife habitat, subsistence resources, and the
			 environment;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: American Energy Independence and Security Act of 2014/s:7/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
a plan be
			 implemented to avoid, minimize, and mitigate (in that order and to the

the development
			 of the plan occur after consultation with—

each agency
			 having jurisdiction over matters mitigated by the plan;

the State of
			 Alaska;

North Slope
			 Borough, Alaska; and
the Arctic Slope Regional Corporation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prepare and promulgate regulations, lease
			 terms,
			 conditions, restrictions, prohibitions, stipulations, or other measures
			 designed to ensure, to the maximum extent practicable, that the activities
			 carried out on the Coastal Plain under this Act are conducted in a manner
			 consistent with the purposes and environmental requirements of this Act.

compliance with

implementation of
			 and compliance with—

standards that

reclamation and rehabilitation requirements in accordance with this Act for the

would assist in

are donated to

reasonable
			 stipulations for protection of cultural and archaeological resources.

manage public

header.#text:
Federal and
			 State distribution of revenues

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, of the amount
			 of bonus, rental, and royalty revenues from oil and gas leasing and
			 operations authorized under this Act—

50 percent shall
			 be paid to the State of Alaska; and

the balance shall
			 be deposited in the Treasury of the United States.

Payments to the State of Alaska under this section shall
			 be made on a monthly basis.
For purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 any
			 rights-of-way or easements across the Coastal Plain for the exploration,
			 development, production, or transportation of oil and gas shall be
			 considered
			 to be established incident to the management of the Coastal Plain under
			 this
			 section.
